[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Chosen Ciphertext Attack] Without authenticated encryption, can attackers submit modified ciphertexts to a decryption oracle to extract private key information or plaintext through chosen ciphertext attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Side-Channel Timing] Does encrypt perform operations in constant time, or can timing variations during G::mul operations leak information about the public key or randomness r? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [RNG Exhaustion] Can an attacker cause RNG exhaustion or failure during encryption, leading to predictable randomness or denial of service in validator encryption operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Ciphertext Component Order] Are the ciphertext components (c0, c1) clearly ordered and validated, or can confusion about component ordering lead to decryption failures or security vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Memory Safety] Is sensitive ephemeral randomness r properly zeroized after use, or does it persist in memory enabling memory scraping attacks to recover randomness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Group Operation Failures] If G::add or G::mul fail or panic during encryption, can attackers trigger these failures to cause denial of service or leak information through error side channels? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Public Key Substitution] Can an attacker substitute the public key pk during encryption to redirect encrypted data to their own key, enabling man-in-the-middle attacks on validator communication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Plaintext Recovery] Without additional authentication, can attackers with oracle access decrypt messages by exploiting the homomorphic properties of ElGamal encryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Identity Element Encryption] What happens if msg is the identity element - does encryption still work correctly, or can this edge case be exploited to distinguish encryptions or cause failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Replay Protection] Does the ElGamal encryption include any replay protection or nonce mechanism, or can old ciphertexts be replayed to validators causing state inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Private Key Validation] Does decrypt validate that the private key sk is non-zero and valid, or can a zero/invalid key be used for decryption causing undefined behavior or information leakage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Ciphertext Component Validation] Does decrypt validate that c0 and c1 are valid non-identity group elements before operations, or can invalid ciphertexts cause panics or leak key material? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Side-Channel Timing] Is G::mul(c0, sk) executed in constant time, or does variable execution time leak private key bits through timing analysis during validator decryption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Invalid Ciphertext Handling] What happens when decrypting invalid or maliciously crafted ciphertexts - can this trigger panics, infinite loops, or computation errors affecting validator availability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Chosen Ciphertext Oracle] Can attackers submit arbitrary ciphertexts to validators for decryption, enabling chosen ciphertext attacks to extract the private key through adaptive queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Memory Safety] Is the intermediate result G::mul(c0, sk) properly handled to prevent memory leaks or use-after-free vulnerabilities in long-running validator processes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Decryption Failures] Does decrypt return errors for invalid ciphertexts, or does it silently return incorrect plaintexts that could propagate through the system causing state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Key Leakage Through Errors] Do error messages or error-handling paths in decrypt leak information about the private key or internal decryption state enabling key recovery? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Power Analysis] Can power consumption patterns during G::mul(c0, sk) leak private key bits through differential power analysis on validator hardware? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Cache Timing Attacks] Do cache access patterns during scalar multiplication leak private key information through cache timing side channels on shared validator infrastructure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Branch Prediction Leakage] Does decrypt contain conditional branches dependent on private key bits, enabling Spectre-style attacks to extract key material from validators? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Identity Element Attack] If c0 is the identity element, does decrypt handle this correctly, or can it cause division by zero, panics, or leak the private key through error behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Group Operation Errors] If G::sub fails or panics during decryption, can attackers exploit this to cause validator crashes or extract information from error recovery paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Concurrent Decryption] If multiple threads decrypt concurrently using the same private key, can race conditions or shared state corruption cause incorrect decryptions or key leakage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt] [Plaintext Validation] Does decrypt validate that the returned plaintext is a valid group element, or can decryption produce invalid elements causing downstream failures? (Low)
